706273f-a.text:
Pierrepont Street, at the N.E. corner of Clinton Street, showing the "Brooklyn Savings Bank". No. 147 Pierrepont Street, is the 4-story bank
building to the right of the bank, which is No. 135.
About 1912.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
706273f-a.folder: Pierrepont Street & Clinton Street, Brooklyn, NY

706272f.text:
Pierrepont Street, west from Clinton Street. At the left is the Long Island Historical Society's Building, and at the right is the Crescent Athletic Club.  This club was erected on the site of Benjamin D. Sillman's
tavern, called "Cant Peek".
1927.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
706272f.folder: Pierrepont Street & Clinton Street, Brooklyn, NY

703655f-a.text:
Clinton Street, east side, at and south of Pierrepont Street. Also shown is Pierrepont Street, south side, east of Clinton Street. Now (1929) the "Brookiyn Trust Co." occupies the corner of Pierrenont Street and southward on Clinton Street to Montague Street. The corner building facing Pierrepont Street was occupied at one time, by the Brooklyn Club which was organized in 1865; later in 1914 the Club was removed to 131 Remsen Street. Prior to the occupation of the building by the Club, it as occupied by the Greenleaf Female Institute.
1914.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
703655f-a.folder: Clinton Street & Pierrepont Street, Brooklyn, NY

703655f-b.text:
Clinton Street, east side, at and south of Pierrepont Street. Also shown is Pierrepont Street, south side, east of Clinton Street. Now (1929) the "Brookiyn Trust Co." occupies the corner of Pierrenont Street and southward on Clinton Street to Montague Street. The corner building facing Pierrepont Street was occupied at one time, by the Brooklyn Club which was organized in 1865; later in 1914 the Club was removed to 131 Remsen Street. Prior to the occupation of the building by the Club, it as occupied by the Greenleaf Female Institute.
1914.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

706274f-b.text:
135-165 Pierrepont Street north side, from Clinton to Fulton Streeta. View, covering Nos. 135-161, shows the Brooklyn Savings Bank (No. 135)
at Clinton Street in the background.
June 2, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

June 2, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
